definitions.definition: To be alive; to have life.
definitions.example: He's not expected to live for more than a few months.

definitions.definition: To have permanent residence somewhere, to inhabit, to reside.
definitions.example: I live at 2a Acacia Avenue.  He lives in LA, but he's staying here over the summer.

definitions.definition: To survive; to persevere; to continue.
definitions.example: Her memory lives in that song.

definitions.definition: To cope.
definitions.example: You'll just have to live with it!  I can't live in a world without you.

definitions.definition: To pass life in a specified manner.
definitions.example: It is difficult to live in poverty.   And they lived happily ever after.

definitions.definition: To spend, as one's life; to pass; to maintain; to continue in, constantly or habitually.
definitions.example: To live an idle or a useful life.

definitions.definition: To act habitually in conformity with; to practice; to exemplify in one's way of life.
To outlast danger; to float (said of a ship, boat, etc).
definitions.example: No ship could live in such a storm.

definitions.definition: (followed by "on" or "upon") To maintain or support one's existence; to provide for oneself; to feed; to subsist.
definitions.example: It is hard to live on the minimum wage.   They lived on stale bread.

definitions.definition: To make the most of life; to experience a full, rich life.
definitions.example: I'm sick of spending every day studying at home: I want to go out there and live!

definitions.definition: Life
(only used attributively) Having life; that is alive.
definitions.example: The post office will not ship live animals.

definitions.definition: Being in existence; actual
definitions.example: He is a live example of the consequences of excessive drinking.

definitions.definition: Having active properties; being energized.
Operational; in actual use rather than in testing etc.
Taken from a living animal.
definitions.example: live feathers

definitions.definition: Imparting power; having motion.
definitions.example: a live, or driving, axle

definitions.definition: Still in active play.
definitions.example: a live ball

definitions.definition: Seen or heard from a broadcast, as it happens.
definitions.example: The station presented a live news program every evening.

definitions.definition: (of a performance or speech) In person.
definitions.example: This nightclub has a live band on weekends.

definitions.definition: (entertainment, performing) Recorded in front of an audience and not having been edited after recording.
definitions.example: a live album

definitions.definition: Of firearms or explosives, capable of causing harm.
definitions.example: The air force practices dropping live bombs on the uninhabited island.

definitions.definition: (circuitry) Electrically charged or energized, usually indicating that the item may cause electrocution if touched.
definitions.example: Use caution when working near live wires.

definitions.definition: Being a bet which can be raised by the bettor, usually in reference to a blind or straddle.
definitions.example: Tommy's blind was live, so he was given the option to raise.

definitions.definition: Featuring humans; not animated, in the phrases “live actors” or “live action”.
Being in a state of ignition; burning.
definitions.example: a live coal; live embers

definitions.definition: Full of earnestness; active; wide awake; glowing.
definitions.example: a live man, or orator

definitions.definition: Vivid; bright.
Of an event, as it happens; in real time; direct.
definitions.example: The concert was broadcast live by radio.

definitions.definition: Of making a performance or speech, in person.
definitions.example: He'll be appearing live at the auditorium.
